snippet: In Roseburg, Ore., and nearby towns, people gathered in churches to share their connections to those who were killed or wounded in the massacre at Umpqua Community College.
abstract: Residents of Roseburg, Ore call on their faith, gathering at local churches to begin healing process; most people in small, tight-knit community have connections to victims in massacre at Umpqua Community College, in which nine people were killed by shooter who reportedly inquired about victims' religious beliefs before firing.

byline.original: By JACK HEALY and LAURA M. HOLSON
byline.contributor: Stephen Farrell contributed reporting from New York, and Claire Cain Miller from Roseburg.

lead_paragraph: In Roseburg, Ore., and nearby towns, people gathered in churches to share their connections to those who were killed or wounded in the massacre at Umpqua Community College.

headline.main: In Close-Knit Oregon Community, Few Are Untouched by College Killings
headline.print_headline: In Close-Knit Oregon Community, Few Are Untouched by College Killings
